newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore HSFO prices steady to firm in quiet talk.
newsitem.headline: Singapore HSFO prices steady to firm in quiet talk.

text.p: High sulphur fuel oil prices were assessed steady to firm on Friday, riding on back of firm crude levels but talk was thin, traders said.

High sulphur 180-cst fuel oil levels were quoted Thursday at $123/$125 for January loading supplies, but January fuel oil swaps were firmer Friday at $121.25/$122.00 per tonne, up around 25 cents on the day.
Traders said firm Brent crude prices offered some support. February Brent rose on SIMEX to $23.50, up 11 cents from their pervious London close on Tuesday.
A bid was seen in the market at $124 for 180-cst material.
Fuel oil traders said prices could face pressure near term as some more Mideast supplies arrive by late January and in the face of lacklutre Chinese demand.
"Demand from China appears to have come to a temporary halt," said a trader.
But Chinese importers told Reuters current prices were too high and importers are holding off purchases until later.
At least two Mideast cargoes were heard to be arriving by late January, traders said.
